metadata.title: sidebarAdaptable | Apple Developer Documentation
metadata.author: Apple Inc.
metadata.summary: Apple Developer Documentation page for the sidebarAdaptable static property of TabViewStyle in SwiftUI. This property provides a tab bar style that adapts its appearance to each platform, displaying as a top tab bar on iPadOS (adaptable to sidebar), bottom tab bar on iOS, sidebar on macOS/tvOS, and ornament with sidebar on visionOS.
metadata.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

content.text: A tab bar style that adapts to each platform.
Tab views using the sidebar adaptable style have an appearance that varies depending on the platform:

items.text: iPadOS displays a top tab bar that can adapt into a sidebar.
iOS displays a bottom tab bar.
macOS and tvOS always show a sidebar.
visionOS shows an ornament and also shows a sidebar for secondary tabs within a Tab Section.

content.text: To apply this style to a tab view, or to a view that contains tab views, use the tabViewStyle(_:) modifier.

content.description: A tab view style that displays a tab bar when possible.
A tab view style that displays a tab bar that groups its tabs together.
A TabViewStyle that displays a paged scrolling TabView.
A TabViewStyle that implements a paged scrolling TabView with an index display mode.
A TabViewStyle that displays a vertical page TabView interaction and appearance.
A TabViewStyle that implements the vertical page TabView interaction and appearance, and performs the specified transition.
A style that implements the carousel interaction and appearance.

sections.text: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

pages.pageSummary: This is an Apple Developer Documentation page for the sidebarAdaptable type property of TabViewStyle in SwiftUI. The page explains that this tab bar style adapts its appearance based on the platform: iPadOS shows a top tab bar adaptable to sidebar, iOS shows a bottom tab bar, macOS and tvOS always show a sidebar, and visionOS shows an ornament with sidebar for secondary tabs. The page includes the Swift declaration with @MainActor and @preconcurrency attributes, platform availability (iOS 18.0+, iPadOS 18.0+, Mac Catalyst 18.0+, macOS 15.0+, tvOS 18.0+, visionOS 2.0+), and a comprehensive 'See Also' section listing other built-in tab view styles.

crossPageElements.runningFooters: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

semanticStructure.documentFlow: The document follows Apple's standard developer documentation layout with a three-column design. The left sidebar shows navigation within the SwiftUI framework hierarchy. The main content area presents the API documentation in a logical flow: type label, heading, description, platform availability, code declaration, availability constraint, discussion with platform-specific behavior, and related APIs. The right sidebar provides quick navigation within the current documentation context. The footer provides comprehensive site navigation.

keyTerms.definition: A static property of TabViewStyle that provides a tab bar style adapting its appearance to each platform
The concrete type returned by the sidebarAdaptable property
A SwiftUI protocol for defining the style of tab views
Swift attribute indicating the property must be accessed from the main actor
Swift attribute for backward compatibility with pre-concurrency code
The SwiftUI modifier used to apply a tab view style to a view
A SwiftUI component used in visionOS for grouping secondary tabs within a sidebar

keyFindings: sidebarAdaptable is available starting iOS 18.0, iPadOS 18.0, Mac Catalyst 18.0, macOS 15.0, tvOS 18.0, and visionOS 2.0

The style adapts differently per platform: iPadOS uses top tab bar convertible to sidebar, iOS uses bottom tab bar, macOS and tvOS always use sidebar, visionOS uses ornament plus sidebar for secondary tabs
The property is only available when Self is SidebarAdaptableTabViewStyle
The tabViewStyle(_:) modifier is used to apply this style to tab views or their containing views

designDecisions.rationale: Different platforms have different UI conventions - bottom tabs on iPhone, top adaptable tabs on iPad, sidebars on Mac/TV, ornaments on Vision Pro
designDecisions.implications: Developers can use a single style that automatically adapts to platform conventions without conditional code

designDecisions.rationale: UI-related properties must be accessed from the main thread for thread safety
designDecisions.implications: Access to this property is restricted to MainActor context
